item.title: Report X-2023090362
item.description:
Report X-2023090362

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-25T03:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-01
  • City: GRIMES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package leaked product on unloaders who moved the wet box. We quickly ascertained the product was ethanol to assure them they were not in danger of a corrosive substance. The package handlers washed hands and returned to work. DescribePack: The release was caused by a loose cap during transport. The continuous sloshing of liquid during transit caused contents to escape the container. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: We immediate isolated the box in a plastic-lined tote and set-aside in the hazmat cage until we could process the DPR and ISF. We used towels to wipe up the wet surface in the trailer.

item.title: Report X-2023090138
item.description:
Report X-2023090138

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-25T03:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-01
  • City: DAVENPORT
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO THE SPILL WEARING ALL PROPER PPE. USING DECSION TREE AND CORROSIVE RESPONSE SHEETS, RESPONDER CONTAINED THE SPILL. ONCE CONTAINED RESPONDER BROUGHT IT TO THE DMP AREA. RESPONDER PROCESSED THE SPILL USING THE WASTE DISPOALE CHART.

item.title: Report E-2023090702
item.description:
Report E-2023090702

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-27T18:15:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-26
  • City: DES MOINES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the valve of the one 250 gallon metal tote of red kero 50 (un1993) had a mechanical failure and had released 16 ounces of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report X-2023090253
item.description:
Report X-2023090253

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-26
  • City: SIOUX CITY
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The bottom of the bottle had a crack and leaked out on to the trailer floor, had the PH exit the trailer, cleaned up the spill and placed the package in a red tote with a lid. DescribePack: Bottom of the bottle cracked DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in red tote

item.title: Report I-2023090111
item.description:
Report I-2023090111

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-26T18:14:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-23
  • City: Manchester
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: THREE RIVERS FS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 6
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1-1450 Gallon NH3 tank ruptured at 2:OOPM Wednesday August 23,2023 at our Manchester FS Facility(location 1000 South 5th Street Manchester Iowa, 52057 while being stored. The end cap separated from the nurse tank causing a large cloud of NH3 to escape into the atmosphere. The cloud had dissipated withing 45 seconds. We determined the cause of this incident was tank failure.
